senses.de: Always doing something at the time that has been agreed
senses.ex: She was always punctual and arrived on time for work every day.

Tips.title: Time Commitments
Tips.description: Use 'punctual' to show respect for others' time by meeting agreed schedules.
Tips.example: He is punctual to meetings, valuing everyone's time.

Tips.title: Cultural Importance
Tips.description: In some cultures, being punctual is critical and appreciated in formal scenarios.
Tips.example: In Japan, punctual train arrivals are expected.

Tips.title: Positive Impression
Tips.description: 'Punctual' often carries a positive connotation, implying reliability and professionalism.
Tips.example: Her punctual habit impressed her boss.

senses.de: Being exact or accurate in details or precision

Tips.title: Exactness Required
Tips.description: Use 'punctual' in technical contexts when precision is crucial and there's no room for error.
Tips.example: Engineers ensure punctual dimensions in aerospace parts.

Tips.title: Attention to Detail
Tips.description: 'Punctual' in detail-oriented fields signifies thoroughness and careful observation.
Tips.example: The scientist's punctual record-keeping aided her research.

Tips.title: Clarity in Communication
Tips.description: When precision matters, 'punctual' conveys clear expectations without ambiguity.
Tips.example: Contract terms require punctual delivery dates.

Accurate.wordDefinition:
Accurate refers to something that is correct or precise. This can be used in a variety of contexts, such as in measuring something or giving information that is exact and correct.

Accurate refers to something that is precise and correct while punctual refers to something that happens on time.

Consistent.wordDefinition:
Consistent refers to something that is always the same, or follows a predictable pattern. For example, a consistent performer regularly delivers high-quality work.

Both words are used to describe reliability, but in different contexts. Consistent is applicable when referring to the quality or pattern of something, while punctual refers to timeliness.

Dependable.wordDefinition:
Dependable means reliable or trustworthy. It refers to someone or something that you can count on to always be there and do what they say they will do.

For example, a car that always starts when you turn the key is dependable.

Both words are applicable in different situations. Dependable is more related to trustworthiness or reliability, while punctual is more related to being on time or meeting deadlines.

A person can be both dependable and punctual.

Exact.wordDefinition:
Exact means completely accurate or precise, while punctual means on time.

Exact describes something that is completely correct or precise, such as a measurement or a calculation.

Punctual describes someone or something that arrives at a specific time or meets a deadline. For example, if you arrive exactly at 3 pm, you are punctual, but if you arrive at 3:01 pm, you are not punctual although you may still be exact.

Exact is used when talking about being completely accurate, while punctual is used when talking about being on time.

Precise.wordDefinition: Precise means being very specific or accurate. It is applicable when describing details or measurements. For example, a precise measurement of ingredients is needed in baking a cake.

Prompt.wordDefinition:
Prompt means to do something quickly or without delay, while punctual means to do something at the scheduled time.

Promptness is applicable in situations where there is urgency or a need to act fast, such as responding to an emergency, completing tasks by a deadline, or showing up for appointments on time.

Reliable.wordDefinition:
Reliable means someone who can be trusted or depended on to do what they say they will do. It usually refers to someone who can be counted on to follow through with commitments, obligations or tasks.

In other words, reliability refers to the ability of someone or something to be trusted or believed in.

On the other hand, reliability is important when someone needs to trust and depend on someone else to complete a task or meet a commitment - like completing a project, keeping a promise or taking care of a responsibility.

Time.wordDefinition:
Punctual refers to being on time or arriving at a designated time. It is applicable when talking about a person's habit of being on time for meetings, appointments, or events.

Time refers to the duration between two events or moments. It is applicable when talking about how long something takes or what time of day it is.

For example, if someone asks what time it is, they are asking for the current time of the day.

Punctual is about being on time, while time is about the duration or specific moment.

quotes.Text: Obviously, your family life is the priority, but there's still other stuff you have to get done in a day. I think the way I make it work is by taking care of myself, and that includes fitness and eating right and all those things, but also by being very organized and punctual.
quotes.Title: American Model
quotes.Name: Cindy Crawford

quotes.Text: Talking to a player helps, but in our sport the majority of learning happens from watching another player. You pick up things like being punctual, being nice to everyone, making sure you give your 100 per cent even in training.
quotes.Name: Sunil Chhetri

quotes.Text: The very success of the modern American family - where kids get punctually to SAT-tutoring classes, the mortgage gets paid, the second-story remodel stays on budget - surely depends on spouses' not being in love.
quotes.Title: American Writer
quotes.Name: Sandra Tsing Loh

quotes.Text: Thus, the technique of metropolitan life is unimaginable without the most punctual integration of all activities and mutual relations into a stable and impersonal time schedule.
quotes.Title: German Sociologist
quotes.Name: Georg Simmel

quotes.Text: There are two types of people in this world: people who can be on time and Nigerians. I am in the latter group, and I confess to my inability to arrive anywhere punctually.
quotes.Title: Nigerian Author
quotes.Name: Luvvie Ajayi

quotes.Text: For this purpose I determined to keep an account of the voyage, and to write down punctually every thing we performed or saw from day to day, as will hereafter appear.
quotes.Title: Italian Explorer
quotes.Name: Christopher Columbus

quotes.Text: Being the daughter of an army officer, I am always punctual.
quotes.Title: Indian Actress
quotes.Name: Kirron Kher

quotes.Text: As a rule, the civil-rights establishment is not punctual.
quotes.Title: American Journalist
quotes.Name: Tucker Carlson

quotes.Text: I work hard, I am punctual and believe that I am sincere.
quotes.Title: Indian Actor
quotes.Name: Suniel Shetty

quotes.Text: I am very punctual about time, eating, and work.
quotes.Title: Indian Actress
quotes.Name: Nikita Dutta
